Package mz.intro

Interface Intro<T extends Comparable>

Type Parameters:
T - setting of a type based on which the elements can be sorted.
All Superinterfaces:
InsertionInterface<T>, QuickInterface<T>, Sort<T>, SortSwap<T>
All Known Subinterfaces:
IntroDPQ<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
IntroAnother, IntroBatcherOddEvenMerge, IntroBubble, IntroCocktail, IntroComb, IntroDoubleSelection, IntroDPQAnother, IntroDPQBatcherOddEvenMerge, IntroDPQBubble, IntroDPQCocktail, IntroDPQComb, IntroDPQDoubleSelection, IntroDPQDualPivotQuick, IntroDPQGnome, IntroDPQHeap, IntroDPQInsertion, IntroDPQMerge, IntroDPQMerge3, IntroDPQMergeInPlace, IntroDPQMergeInsertion, IntroDPQOddEven, IntroDPQOddEvenMerge, IntroDPQQuick, IntroDPQQuick3, IntroDPQSelection, IntroDPQShell, IntroDPQSmoothHeap, IntroDPQStableQuick, IntroDPQTernaryHeap, IntroDPQTim, IntroDPQWeakHeap, IntroDPQWeaveMerge, IntroDPQWiki, IntroDualPivotQuick, IntroGnome, IntroHeap, IntroInsertion, IntroMerge, IntroMerge3, IntroMergeInPlace, IntroMergeInsertion, IntroOddEven, IntroOddEvenMerge, IntroQuick, IntroQuick3, IntroSelection, IntroShell, IntroSmoothHeap, IntroStableQuick, IntroTernaryHeap, IntroTim, IntroWeakHeap, IntroWeaveMerge, IntroWiki
public interface Intro<T extends Comparable> extends Sort<T>, InsertionInterface<T>, QuickInterface<T>
Intro Sort is a hybrid sorting algorithm that combines the strengths of Quick Sort and Insertion Sort. It aims to provide fast average-case performance while maintaining worst-case guarantees. The basic idea behind Intro Sort is to start with Quick Sort, which is known for its efficiency on average, but has a worst-case time complexity of O(n^2) in certain scenarios. To mitigate the risk of Quick Sort's worst-case behavior, Intro Sort monitors the recursion depth during the sorting process. If the depth exceeds a certain threshold, the algorithm switches to HeapSort, which guarantees worst-case O(n log(n)) time complexity but has higher overhead. Additionally, for small subarrays, IntroSort switches to Insertion Sort, which has good performance for small input sizes.
Since:
1.0
Author:
Magyar Zoltán

  • Field Details

    • INTRO_SIZE

      static final int INTRO_SIZE
      Size of each intro
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • introInc

      default void introInc(T[] array)
      introInc that serves as the entry point for performing an Intro Sort on the given array.
      An Override call is required to use the Interface method.
      • This line calls the introRecursiveInc method to perform the IntroSort on the array. The parameters passed are:
      • 0 The starting index of the array.
      • The ending index (inclusive) of the array.
      • The maximum depth or recursion level allowed for Quick Sort. It is calculated as twice the logarithm (base 2) of the length of the array, rounded down to the nearest integer. This value determines when the algorithm switches to a different sorting method.
      • default void introInc(T[] array), call introRecursiveInc(array, 0, (array.length - 1), (int) (2 * Math.floor(Math.log(array.length))));
      introInc method provides a convenient entry point for sorting an array using the IntroSort algorithm. It calculates the maximum depth based on the array length and then calls the introRecursiveInc method to perform the sorting.
      Parameters:
      array - The array to be sorted.
      See Also:
      • introRecursiveInc(Comparable[], int, int, int)

    • introDec

      default void introDec(T[] array)
      introDec that serves as the entry point for performing an Intro Sort on the given array.
      An Override call is required to use the Interface method.
      • This line calls the introRecursiveInc method to perform the IntroSort on the array. The parameters passed are:
      • 0 The starting index of the array.
      • The ending index (inclusive) of the array.
      • The maximum depth or recursion level allowed for Quick Sort. It is calculated as twice the logarithm (base 2) of the length of the array, rounded down to the nearest integer. This value determines when the algorithm switches to a different sorting method.
      • default void introDec(T[] array), call introRecursiveDec(array, 0, (array.length - 1), (int) (2 * Math.floor(Math.log(array.length))));
      introInc method provides a convenient entry point for sorting an array using the IntroSort algorithm. It calculates the maximum depth based on the array length and then calls the introRecursiveInc method to perform the sorting.

      See Also:

    • introRecursiveInc

      default void introRecursiveInc(T[] array, int left, int right, int maxDepth)
      introRecursiveInc method implements an adaptive sorting algorithm called Intro Sort.
      • This condition checks if the size of the subarray is greater than INTRO_SIZE. If true, the array is large enough to be sorted using QuickSort.
      • This condition checks if the maximum depth has been reached. If true, the maximum depth has been exceeded, and the sorting algorithm switches to another sorting method.
      • introSortClassInc(array, left, right): If the maximum depth has been reached, the introSortClassInc method is called to sort the subarray using a different sorting algorithm.
      • partitionInc(array, left, right): If the maximum depth has not been reached, the partitionInc method is called to perform the partitioning step of QuickSort. It returns the index of the pivot element.
      • The introRecursiveInc method is recursively called on the left subarray (elements smaller than the pivot) to further sort it.
      • The introRecursiveInc method is recursively called on the right subarray (elements greater than the pivot) to further sort it.
      • Else the size of the subarray is not greater than INTRO_SIZE, the array is considered small, and the insertionInc method is called to perform insertion sort on the subarray.
      • This is a method declaration for introSortClassInc. It appears to be a separate sorting algorithm that is called when the maximum depth is reached.
      introRecursiveInc method implements an adaptive sorting algorithm called Intro Sort. It combines the Quick Sort algorithm with a switch to another sorting algorithm Insertion Sort when the recursion depth exceeds a specified threshold maxDepth. The purpose of this adaptive approach is to optimize performance by leveraging the strengths of different sorting algorithms depending on the input size.
      Parameters:
      array - The array to be sorted.
      left - The starting index of the subarray to be sorted.
      right - The ending index (inclusive) of the subarray to be sorted.
      maxDepth - The maximum depth or recursion level allowed before switching to another sorting algorithm.
      See Also:
      • INTRO_SIZE
      • introInc(Comparable[])
      • introSortClassInc(Comparable[], int, int)
      • InsertionInterface.insertionInc(Comparable[], int, int)

    • introRecursiveDec

      default void introRecursiveDec(T[] array, int left, int right, int maxDepth)
      introRecursiveDec method implements an adaptive sorting algorithm called Intro Sort.
      • This condition checks if the size of the subarray is greater than INTRO_SIZE. If true, the array is large enough to be sorted using QuickSort.
      • This condition checks if the maximum depth has been reached. If true, the maximum depth has been exceeded, and the sorting algorithm switches to another sorting method.
      • introSortClassDec(array, left, right): If the maximum depth has been reached, the introSortClassDec method is called to sort the subarray using a different sorting algorithm.
      • partitionDec(array, left, right): If the maximum depth has not been reached, the partitionDec method is called to perform the partitioning step of QuickSort. It returns the index of the pivot element.
      • The introRecursiveDec method is recursively called on the left subarray (elements smaller than the pivot) to further sort it.
      • The introRecursiveDec method is recursively called on the right subarray (elements greater than the pivot) to further sort it.
      • Else the size of the subarray is not greater than INTRO_SIZE, the array is considered small, and the insertionInc method is called to perform insertion sort on the subarray.
      • This is a method declaration for introSortClassDec. It appears to be a separate sorting algorithm that is called when the maximum depth is reached.
      introRecursiveDec method implements an adaptive sorting algorithm called Intro Sort. It combines the Quick Sort algorithm with a switch to another sorting algorithm Insertion Sort when the recursion depth exceeds a specified threshold maxDepth. The purpose of this adaptive approach is to optimize performance by leveraging the strengths of different sorting algorithms depending on the input size.
      Parameters:
      array - The array to be sorted.
      left - The starting index of the subarray to be sorted.
      right - The ending index (inclusive) of the subarray to be sorted.
      maxDepth - The maximum depth or recursion level allowed before switching to another sorting algorithm.
